sermons.title: (1 Peter - Part 1): Introduction to 1st Peter
sermons.description: This is a general introduction to the book of 1 Peter, beginning with a 15min sketch of Peter and who he was(and was not) in the church. Followed by a 15min explanation of who Peter was writing to and the current landscape of the roman world. That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the Glory of God the Father. Phil 2:10-11

sermons.title: (1 Peter - Part 11): Wherefore, Gird Up Your Minds and be Sober
sermons.description: This teaching is on the need for Christians to live a disciplined life. To seek after righteousness, faithfulness, and truth. And to not live complacent christian lives as many do.

sermons.title: (1 Peter - Part 13): On Fashioning Ourselves as Christians
sermons.description: This is a sermon on being fashioned not after the world but after Christ. Tozer gives a thorough list of factors which will fashion our lives, whether for the good or bad. This sermon speaks of our lives before our being born again and how we need to fashion our lives according to our new nature which is holy in all conversation. God is holy and our walk as Christians need to be holy to as Tozer mentions.

sermons.title: (Dangers in the Way Series): Dangers of Bondage and Liberty
(Dangers in the Way Series): Dangers of Idleness and Busyness
(Dangers in the Way Series): Resisting the Worlds Propoganda
(Daniel) Twenty One Days of Prayer
sermons.description: Willie Mullan preaches expositionally through the first part of the tenth chapter of Daniel. He exhorts and uses many examples and scriptures towards praying, true praying. "Some of us have not been at it yet" (in reference to true praying). The devil fights most strongly against us when we pray. What a need to understand the schemes of the devil and principalities and powers that we fight against.

sermons.title: (Ephesians) Citizens of the Household of God
(Ephesians) Doing All Things For The Lord
(Ephesians) From The Pit To The Pinnacle
(Forging the Vessel of Recovery) 1- The Success of the First Century Church
(Forging the Vessel of Recovery) 5- A Vessel Of Glory
(Fury of Fire) 09 - Close to Being Cursed
(Godly Home) Part 16 - Train Up a Child
sermons.description: Brother Denny illustrates how training and nurturing are "a beautiful blend of teaching, discipline, love and the actual guiding of a life in a right path."  Do you want your child to be a soul winner or prayer warrior?  What do you want to teach them?  He gives several practical ways of going about the training process in a purposeful, God-centered way.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 24 - Godly men have radiant Wives
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston shares how the woman is the glory of the man; therefore the husband needs to take care of his "glow-ry".  A number of practical ways husbands can lay their lives down for their wives are things like praise and attention, quality time, unconditional love and acceptance.  These expressions of love are what contribute to a radiant wife who is the crown of her husband.

sermons.title: (Missions Conference Shoals) - Part 6
sermons.description: Paul continues his teachings on God's love, but with an emphasis on our response. He teaches how God has chosen us to be a revelation to His creation of His love and glory. How precious our relationship is to Him. Are you passionately in love with Him? Are you giving Him all of you or are you just giving Him activity? Oh, how great is His love.

sermons.title: (Presenting Christ #1) The Need For Fullness
sermons.description: "Saints, having seen the greater, will put away the lesser," says brother Dana.  How do we get distracted from experiencing the fullness promised in Christ?  And are we aware of the great gathering in the world today, evangelizing with the end in view, or sitting passively on the sideline?  (This series of messages delivered at 2006 Christian Family Conference).

sermons.title: (Presenting Christ #2) Summing Up All Things In Christ Through The Word
sermons.description: "True revelation is you see Christ FIRST, and then that revelation out of Christ."  Dana shows how the Word presents Christ as the sum of all things and how the Bible itself is summed up in Christ.  He testifies how it was he came to see Jesus Christ as "the hidden thread" that held all of the Scripture together.

sermons.title: (Presenting Christ #3) Fullness And Glory
sermons.description: "If we want our lives to be summed up and full of Christ," says brother Dana, "there is a subtraction process."  Tribulation in our lives teaches us to value the glory of Christ.  If you set your heart to seek Him, you can be guaranteed to be resisted by the devil, the world and your flesh.

sermons.title: (South West Baptist Church 2008) Have You Let Go
(The Better Covenant) 5 - Satan Defeated
sermons.description: One way to tell if you are still living under the old covenant is whether you still fight with human beings.  When Satan was defeated on the cross, believers now war against the real enemy which even the greatest saints of the old covenant could never do.  Beware of certain sins that can bring you into fellowship with the devil, such as pride, lying and anger.

sermons.title: (The Better Covenant) 6 - Fellowship in One Body
sermons.description: Personal holiness must lead to being built together with others into one body, otherwise it's a deception.  It's not the brothers and sisters of faraway lands that perfects holiness in us, but the one in our local assembly that irritates us or rubs us the wrong way.  Each little church must be an expression of Christ's body, which blends people who are totally different in one by the power of the Holy Spirit.

sermons.title: (Women) 02. What fruit can be expected from a happy marriage (part1)
(Women) 03. What fruit can be expected from a happy marriage (part2)
01 Acknowledgements
sermons.description: Every New Testament Epistle is full of acknowledgments1 of believers who were in different cities and those who were laboring hard in the Lord. The names of those who have had a part in this volume are too numerous to mention. To all those who labored in editing, revising, suggesting and offering your counsel we are indebted. Above every human help we recognize the Lordâ€™s hand in this volume from the start to finish. The messages in this book were birthed out of a genuine burden2 of the Lord and we pray this burden has been conveyed with as little interference from the human vessels3 as possible.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 04 Introduction Letter
sermons.description: Greetings in the precious Name of our Lord Jesus Christ. To all who are reading this book, called to be saints and beloved of God, grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. With such powerful modern movements of the Spirit such as the house Church Movement in China,20 the underground Church in North Korea, and the underground Church in Iran, we need to reevaluate the fruitfulness of the body of Christ in our countries.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 07 Principle 3 - Gods People Scattered in Sects
sermons.description: We see the beginning of a movement where God is waking up many of His sheep to hear His voice in the midst of the noise and rustle of the denominational confusion. God never intended His Church to be divided,72 confused and led back and forward with every wind of doctrine. â€œThen we will no longer be infants, tossed back and forth by the waves, and blown here and there by every wind of teaching and by the cunning and craftiness of people in their deceitful scheming.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 100. What doth the preface of the Lord’s Prayer teach us?
16 Principle 12 - Jesus Christ The Head of the Church
sermons.description: The Headship of Jesus Christ was not just a doctrine or an idea to the early Apostles but rather a present reality to them. The Lord was the active Head of the Church. They realized it was His Church and everything was done in His Name for Him and through Him.224 This apostolic dependency on the person of Jesus Christ allowed the Lord to be in control of each Assembly. â€œGod placed all things under His feet and appointed Him to be Head over everything for the Church, which is His body, the fullness of Him who fills everything in every way.â€
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 19. What is the misery of that estate whereinto man fell?
20. Did God leave all mankind to perish in the estate of sin and misery?
22 Principle 18 - The Satanic Counterfeit
sermons.description: Though God is always working in different ways and with different means, it is still only by the Spirit of God that the Church will grow. Over the past 50 years particularly originating in Western countries there have been such excesses and abuses of what is considered Spirit-filled Christianity that many true believers have been repulsed completely from even seeking the Lord for the true filling of the Spirit. This is not only a tragedy but one of Satanâ€™s tactics323 to hinder the growth of the true Church of Jesus Christ. The genuine believer should never feel scared to call out to God for fresh infusions of the Spirit of God for service324 and to foster a dependence on the Holy Spirit of God daily in his life.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 3-minute call to prayer
sermons.description: This clip was taken from the end of a message spoken in America in 2005 about the Armor of God (Ephesians 6:10-18). Verwer clearly shows how the lack of holiness and church vibrancy in our day is simply that we forsook the prayer meetings 50 years ago. This is a powerful call to re-establish prayer as the utmost priority in our churche's and chrisitan life's.

sermons.title: 30. How doth the Spirit apply to us the redemption purchased by Christ?
32. What benefits do they that are effectually called partake of in this life?
33 - The Unity of the Church of Christ
sermons.description: Ben Torrey shares a short talk on the unity of the body of Christ. He clearly shows how Paul the Apostle speaks of unity and his passion for all early believers to be unified under the Lord. When we are not in right relationship with others in the Church we blaspheme God's name and authority over our lives. We must be one with each other as we are one in faith in Christ Jesus.

sermons.title: 36 Principle 32 - Godliness Through the Act of Submission
sermons.description: One of the most important areas of godliness in the life of a believer is the area of submission. If one is not submissive but rebellious in spirit, there is a great danger of pride and sin. Many warnings are given in Scripture towards that state of rebellion and un-submissiveness in a believerâ€™s life. We must recognize Godâ€™s sovereignty and rule over all creation, our lives and the Church. We must submit our minds to the authority of Scripture as we submit to God in our spirits; He owns us now.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 39 Principle 35 - The Lord Supper The Death of Christ
sermons.description: The Lordâ€™s Supper is clearly a New Testament practice that the early disciples kept, as its significance is tied into the end of the age. The Scripture says that as we remember the Lord we are proclaiming His death until He comes back.555 This death is important because by the death of Christ, He took upon Himself our sins and absolved the wrath of God on our behalf.556 What a glorious Good News to celebrate that this is a finished work557 and we do not have to suffer the wrath of God for our sins if we are in Jesus Christ and walking in a life of true discipleship with Him.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 44 Principle 40 - The Body of Christ Is the Church
sermons.description:
Many times we are preoccupied with the idea that the building where we worship is the Church. Yet in the early Church and Biblical record, God calls the people themselves the Church.629
One of the main desires in church planting in North America is the constructing of a church building after a group of believers is established. This is not always helpful. The true work of God is not dependent on money and resources to grow but rather on hearts that have been affected by the Gospel of our Lord. If we focus on building structures and churches, we can subtly deceive the people to depend on such structures630 and not the living Lord.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 53 Principle 49 - Sharing and Memorization of Scripture
sermons.description: Psalm 119 is the longest chapter in Scripture and it is devoted to exclaiming the wonders of Godâ€™s Word and Law. It would be a worthy practice for us to read this chapter over and over to allow God to build in us an admiration and love for His Scriptures again. Would you forfeit all the riches you possess, to simply have in your possession a copy of Godâ€™s holy Word? The Psalmist might have for he proclaimed: â€œThe Law from Your mouth is more precious to me than thousands of pieces of silver and gold.â€ May we emulate our North Korean brothers and sisters by treating Godâ€™s Word as the most precious possession we have.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 55 Principle 51- Measuring True Christian Growth
sermons.description: Paul the Apostle shares with the young Timothy: â€œBe diligent in these matters; give yourself wholly to them, so that everyone may see your progress.â€727 It is possible for others to see your growth in the Lord. Thus gathering in homes and in more intimate meetingsâ€”not just once a weekâ€”will allow us to encourage each other to grow authentically in our walks with the Lord and not remain hid in the back of a large public church meeting.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 64. What is required in the fifth commandment?
66. What is the reason annexed to the fifth commandment?
68. What is required in the sixth commandment?
7. What are the decrees of God?
72. What is forbidden in the seventh commandment?
75. What is forbidden in the eighth commandment?
8. How doth God execute his decrees?
A Biblical family - a tool in God´s hands (part 2)
sermons.description:
It is important for every parent to remember that God often visits the sins of the parents on the children - to the third and fourth generation. Even your selfishness and greed you pass on to your children and they suffer because of you. Turn therefore completely in all sincerity from all sin. It might not trouble you now, but one day it will be revealed and it will be terrible. 
But to those who love God, He blesses to the thousand's generation. A certain newly-born baby simply did not stop crying and the doctor could not find the problem. Eventually he called for a specialist, but still they failed to diagnose the problem. Eventually one of the doctors had an idea, and he took a cigarette and blew the smoke into the face of the child. Immediately the crying stopped. His mother smoked and the child suffered from nicotine-withdrawal symptoms.

sermons.title: A GREATER POWER
sermons.description: God lives and works today! Do you feel oppressed by the powers of darkness that fill our world today – the powers of hatred, suffering and death? This program will tell about a power that is greater than all of these.

sermons.title: A Healthy Body
sermons.description: We need to see the importance of the local body of believers. God wants each of us to be a meaningful, healthy part. It isn’t possible to be the whole body ourselves. Being part of the local body is a protection from “every wind of doctrine”. A healthy body doesn’t just depend on the preacher; it starts with everyone being a part.

sermons.title: A Proper Orientation
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson asserts that the goal of Christianity is not a change in location, but a change in what we are. He endeavors to get us to shift our focus off of Heaven as the goal, and onto being transformed into the image of Jesus Christ, and being reunited with the Father. Please bring your thinking cap for this one. (1 hour 18 minutes).

sermons.title: A Pure Heart
sermons.description: Alan Martin takes us through the Scriptures to show that true purity is what is right in God's eyes, not man's. He then shows the way to achieve this purity: By taking heed to God's Word and receiving the Light--Jesus Christ. The pure in heart shall see God, and from the pure heart, enabled by God, comes forth gracious speech.  (NOTE: This is the follow-on sermon to "Gracious Speech")

sermons.title: A Warning To America by Keith Daniel
sermons.description: Keith Daniel gives a solemn warning to the Church of Jesus Christ in America, that we must pray before its too late. The church should not use wordly methods to win the world it will not work! The main thrust of the sermon is preached from Ephesians 6:10-18 and the emphasis is that the church needs to get into warfare on their knees. God can still change America and other nations to be God fearing and righteous again.

sermons.title: A Warning To American Christianity
sermons.description: Keith Daniel gives a solemn warning to the Church of Jesus Christ in America, that we must pray before its too late. The church should not use wordly methods to win the world it will not work! The main thrust of the sermon is preached from Ephesians 6:10-18 and the emphasis is that the church needs to get into warfare on their knees. God can still change America and other nations to be God fearing and righteous again.

sermons.title: Abounding Love of Paul for the Saints
sermons.description: "We can talk a big talk," David Smithers exhorts, "but unless we can love one another we're not going to go deeper."  The end of all Christian growth is love, and we're to abound in it.  Smithers addresses many hard hitting issues of lovelessness and a lack of God's grace that hinder Christlikeness in our lives.  How does our love measure up to Jesus Christ?

sermons.title: Amazing Grace
sermons.description:
For by grace are ye saved through faith, Ephesians 2:8

Amazing grace! How sweet the sound
That saved a wretch like me
I once was lost but now am found,
Was blind but now I see

‘Twas grace that taught my heart to fear
And grace my fears relieved
How precious did that grace appear
The hour I first believed

The Lord has promised good to me
His word my hope secures
He will my shield and portion be
As long as life endures

Through many dangers, toils, and snares
I have already come
‘Tis grace hath brought me safe thus far
And grace will lead me home

When we’ve been there ten-thousand years
Bright shining as the sun
We’ve no less days to sing God’s praise
Than when we first begun

sermons.title: Americas Only Hope
sermons.description: Brother Daniel gives a solemn warning to the Church of Jesus Christ we must pray before its too late. There is a digression in the sermon on the topic of music but its application finds itself in that the church should not use wordly methods to win the world it will not work! The main thrust of the sermon is preached from ephesians 6 and the emphasis is that the church needs to get into warfare on their knees.

sermons.title: An Habitation of God
sermons.description: For anyone who has ever questioned "why are we here?" this is an important and revealing message about the motives and expectations the Lord has of people. The Lord has a very deep desire to have an intimate heart to heart sharing relationship with his children. If you have difficulty praying, or are in a battle of the mind, insecure about the Lord's love for you, you must hear this wonderfully encouraging message. God loves us, and desires fellowship with us.

sermons.title: Are You Tired Of Being God?
sermons.description: November 28, 2010 - Man's inherent problem is that he thought in himself that he could be God. We all have a sin nature in us that desires to make choices apart from the will of God. God gave us the law as a school master to prove to us that we can't keep it. When we try to struggle our way out of a situation we are being God in that area. When we try to defeat sin in our own strength we are being God in that area. God the Father and Jesus Christ made a covenant with each other to put an end to sin and the power it has over us. It is only when we bend our knee to God and put our faith in the finished work of the Cross the struggle stops and God can be God to us. WE don't make promises to God, He makes them to us and He keeps them. It is not about works, it is all about faith in what Christ has already done.

sermons.title: Authority Over Demons
sermons.description: "We cannot do anything, without Jesus we can do nothing." The bible does not have any suggestions but commandments. Corrie Ten Boom shares on the subject of spiritual warfare through her experience and the scriptures. We must have Jesus as our foundation and only support we stand on as we contend and resist the demons and the evil one in this earth.

sermons.title: Authority Over Demons by Corrie Ten Boom
sermons.description: "We cannot do anything, without Jesus we can do nothing." The bible does not have any suggestions but commandments. Corrie Ten Boom shares on the subject of spiritual warfare through her experience and the scriptures. We must have Jesus as our foundation and only support we stand on as we contend and resist the demons and the evil one in this earth.

sermons.title: Balance, Not Tangents
sermons.description: Verwer explains that balance is not compromise but is holding various strong scriptural truths in the light of other strong scriptural truths. He lists many tangents that need to be avoided. Although we must "not be nibblers of the possible but grabbers of the possible" this needs to be held in balance with common sense. There are many tensions that need to be maintained between seeming opposites in the journey to being more Christ-like.

sermons.title: Be Rich: I Know a Secret
Be Strong in the Lord
sermons.description: In the world people are fighting against flesh and blood, one race against another race, one nation against another nation. But we do not fight against flesh and blood but rather against principalities and rulers of the darkness of this age. The Word tells us, finally, be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might. The power of the Lord Jesus is great. However, the devil and demons have power too but limited. But God's power is the greatest, and He has commanded us to go into all the world and make disciples of all nations and teach them to keep all that He has commanded us (Matt 28:19-20). You do not get salvation through education. Education without Christ just produces clever devils. Jesus commanded us to teach the nations, not just to know, but to keep all that He has taught us.

sermons.title: Becoming a House For God
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson touches on the difference between “going to Heaven” versus “going to The Father.” He addresses the problems with the King James word “mansion” in our understanding of what God is doing. He discusses in depth John 14:3. The “house” referred to in the phrase “In My Father’s House…” is not Heaven, but Jesus Himself – Jesus is the house of God. Not that Heaven does not exist, but it is not the goal. Jesus is the Father’s house, and He makes a place in Himself for us, so that we become a room in that house. This sermon is practical, and it will stretch your brain a bit. (49 minutes 36 seconds)

sermons.title: Becoming a Solider God's army requires a Personal Calvary
Becoming a Solider God's army requires a Personal Calvary (High Quality)
Being Filled With The Holy Spirit
Being Filled with the Spirit
sermons.description: We need to know the Holy Ghost, because Heâ€™s our life.  We need to drink of that Fountain of life.  It isnâ€™t sufficient to be baptized with the Holy Ghost, but now to walk in the Spirit, â€œe has translated you out of the kingdom of darkness.â€  How many people claim to be baptized with the Holy Ghost, and theyâ€™re satisfied to still live in the flesh, and theyâ€™re satisfied to still be governed by the flesh!  Thatâ€™s where our frowns come from.  But beloved, that, the Bible says, is dangerous: â€œIf we live in the flesh, we shall die.â€  We shall die!  â€œBut if ye live in the spiritâ€¦â€  Do you know the Spirit?  Do you know the Holy Ghost?  Is He your habitation?  Is He your realm?  Is He the ocean of life and of light and of grace and of love and of joy and of peace into which youâ€™ve been sunk, deeply sunk, so that your whole being has been transformed into this ocean of love?  â€œHave you received the Holy Ghost?â€

sermons.title: Binding God to His Own Word
sermons.description: February 11, 2007 - We are invited to come boldly to the Throne of Grace, "Christ Possessed", knowing He is Our Father and He is also our King. When God speaks and makes a decree He speaks by His Living Word and He is Bound to His own promises and divine purposes. We cannot go into God's presence without a promise from His Word. When God speaks a word to you don't consult with your flesh and don't allow your feelings of unworthiness to effect your prayers. We are to come boldly with a fixed position, believing the truth and power of His Word. We do not try to persuade God, but rather are fully persuaded with a fixed position to the faithfulness of His Word.

sermons.title: Building a Godly Timeline
sermons.description: Using Ephesians 2, Steve systematically leads his audience through the typical believer’s life: from the time he was lost, following the masses toward the brink of hell; to his salvation and the lifetime of works that will surely follow; and on into a rich and eternal reward in glory.

sermons.title: Children
sermons.description: Keith Daniel shares many testimonies and stories of how children were raised in right and wrong ways. He shares multiple scriptures on verses of responsibility for parents to train children in the ways of God. We need to have the Spirit of Christ in all training of children is a precept he underlines.

sermons.title: Chosen to be Holy
sermons.description: Alan Redpath speaks with prophetic urgency and in the power of the Holy Spirit. The Church is helpless without the power of the Holy Spirit. In a day and age of techniques and man-made programs this message is like a clarion call to the church of this day. May God impart it to this generation and let us respond to its call!

sermons.title: Christ's Love to His Spouse
sermons.description: With great reverence, let us think, first, of how Christ loves the church; then, secondly, how he has proved his love by giving himself for the church; and then, thirdly, let us make the practical enquiry, how shall we think of this wondrous love of Christ?

sermons.title: Christian Combat - God's Armor: What to Have
Christian Combat - God's Armor: What to Take
Christian Combat - God's Strength and How to Get It
Christian Combat - The Fact and Foe of  Christian Combat
Christian Combat - The Goal of Christian Combat: Stand
Christian Combat - What to do with God's Armor
Church History - The Apostolic Church (33-100)
sermons.description: Christianity is more a religion based on factual eventsrather than philosophical supposition.  The death and ressurection of the Lord Jesus, the centre point of christianity, were factual events and these are the basis for our faith.  An ancient secular roman historian called Talus confirms the darkness that covered the earth following the death of the Lord Jesus, because he was alive at the time.  F.F. Bruce said that 'Anyone who propagates the idea that Jesus was a myth is neither a historian nor unbiased.' The distice features of the apostolic church were 1: the prescence of the foundational apostles 2:The unprecidented problems and victories of the church 3:The speed with which the Gospel spread 4:The transition of christianity from a branch of judaism to a seperate religion.

sermons.title: Cincinatti Missions 1993 Conference Commitment To The Assembly
Cleansed by the Blood
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson begins discussing the idea that we do not wrestle against flesh and blood, but against principalities, etc. He discusses the dynamics of spiritual warfare, including the concept of “two armies” – An army of warriors (angels) and an army of judges (men). The delay in Christ’s return has to do with the fact that the “army of judges” is not ready yet, he says. This life of trials and tests is to form Christ in us – which makes us ready to judge and rule with Him. He segues into the purpose of the blood of Christ: it forgives our sins, it cleanses sin, it covers us (for protection), it nourishes the inner man, it deadens the power of sin over you, and it will literally remove the sin from you (at His coming). The sermon is much more interesting than I’m making it sound.

sermons.title: Complete Faith
sermons.description: Discussed here is the unregenerate soul; natural man, or animal man as Major Thomas describes man without Christ.

sermons.title: Confidence
sermons.description: â€œCast not away therefore your confidence.â€  Confidence.  Can you have confidence in anything at all today?  Everybody lies.  â€œAll men are liars.â€  You might as well put it down in your notebook.  â€œAll men are liars,â€ but thereâ€™s One thatâ€™s not a liar.  Thereâ€™s One in Whom you can safely confide, and youâ€™re commanded to have confidence in God.  The Bible says, â€œCast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.â€  But now, my God, who are You going to reward?  Whom are You going to honor like that?  Who do You want to have confidence in You?  Me?  Poor weak mortalâ€”poor weak thing that cannot have confidence in himself!

sermons.title: Desert Survival Series Pt 16- Moses The Servant of God
Desiring the Sincere Milk of the Word
sermons.description: That is the great need: create desire within me; make me love you more, Jesus; make my soul to desire You.  And thereâ€™s a very simple way to do that.  The Bible tells us that â€œas newborn babesâ€ we have to grow.  â€œGrow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.â€  Who would like to see a baby remain a baby?  You wouldnâ€™t like that, would you?  Youâ€™d like to see them grow, get strong, get tall, become men and women.  And so my God has ordained that His children should grow, and grow into the full stature of the full measure of the manhood in Christ Jesus.

sermons.title: Destroying Pop-Christian Views of Marital Bliss - Part 1
sermons.description: This is not your typical wedding sermon that is forgotten as soon as it is preached... it is full of practical, biblical and powerful advice about marriage and God's purpose for it. This sermon is not just for those seeking marriage or those recently married, it will even benefit those who have been married for decades.

sermons.title: Destroying Pop-Christian Views of Marital Bliss - Part 2
sermons.description: This is not your typical wedding sermon that is forgotten as soon as it is preached... it is full of practical, biblical and powerful advice about marriage and God's purpose for it. This sermon is not just for those seeking marriage or those recently married, it will even benefit those who have been married for decades.

sermons.title: Enlarging Our Hearts
sermons.description: Zac Poonen speaks on the problem in the corinthian church and many believers today of having a narrow heart, that is the reason they were fleshy, babes and never grew spiritually. But Paul the apostle exhorts the believers to "enlarge" their hearts and not have a narrow hearts. There are 2 things that make a persons heart narrow or large: Faith and Love.

sermons.title: Ephesians 2
sermons.description: nil;

sermons.title: Fathers, Bring Them Up in the Discipline and Instruction of the Lord
Finishing the Course - 01 Staying within our boundaries
First Commandment With a Promise
sermons.description: This message deals with honoring your parents.

sermons.title: Four R's of the Gospel: Ruin
Freedom From This World System
sermons.description: There is a distinction between “loving the world” and not being “of the world,” that believers must make.  We are not called to hide from the world, but rather we are to be in it while being completely freed from its clutches, and free from its systemic tyranny over our lives.  This sermon shows how, if you use worldly methods to attract people to your fellowships, worldly people are all you will attract.  Brother Zac uses a flurry of scriptures to blow away any notion that it is acceptable to God to still be of this present evil world.

sermons.title: From Captive to Captain
sermons.description: March 23, 2008 - When we begin to pray for those who are lost God will sometimes answer by sending a storm into their lives. During this storm our friends and family who have in past times rejected us will come to us for help in their time of need. God will allow us to begin to guide them with Godly direction and provision. When we are gripped by God for the souls of men He will gives us strength and wisdom to be broken bread for them. The only way we can make it on this journey is to understand that the suffering we go through is worth it for those who don't know Jesus yet.

sermons.title: God At War With Flesh
sermons.description: Major Thomas uses quite a few Scripture to lead us to the realization that we have power over our flesh through Christ.   He wonderfully illustrates this with Moses and the “smitten rock” and Esau as being he devil incarnate.

sermons.title: God's Desire Is For A Bride Of Christ
sermons.description: Brother David shares a powerful exhortation for the Headship of Jesus Christ and for the Church to seek to be a Bride for Christ. There is an end times purpose of God to see a assembled body of Christ that is a Bride to Him.  We need in the West the proper relationship with Christ to His Church.

sermons.title: God's Intention For This Midnight Hour
Gospel Healing for Hurting Marriages
sermons.description: In an age when Christians seek therapy before the seek the Lord, it is important to be reminded that God is a primary, not a secondary source when it comes to healing hurting marriages. Far from being silent on the issue of conflict resolution, the Bible has much to say on the subject.

sermons.title: Holy Spirit and The Crisis of Pentecost - Part 3
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 05/01/1959.

sermons.title: Holy Spirit and The Crisis of Pentecost - Part 4
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 05/01/1959.

sermons.title: Holy Spirit, Church and Nations - Part 4
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 05/01/1957. God's will is that believers would be filled with the Holy Spirit, and that the Church would be a testimony and witness to the nations of the world. The Holy Spirit came to reproduce the Lord Jesus Christ in the lives of men and women.

sermons.title: How Satan Destroys a Church - Part 1 (GUARD YOUR GARDEN)
sermons.description: Satan seeks to destroy the church by attacking the Christian home.  He can wreak havoc in the church by destroying marriages and influencing the husband or wife to step out of their God ordained roles.  The basis of the home is marriage, the basis of marriage is a life long relationship, the basis of that is agreement.

sermons.title: How Satan Destroys a Church - Part 2 (HOW SATAN DESTROYS BY DIVIDING)
sermons.description: Satan seeks to destroy the church by dividing us from God and each other.  Rebellion against authority by anyone can bring destruction.  In the home the husband can lose his leadership by not loving his wife as instructed in Ephesians 5 and his wife will greatly suffer by his lack of love and the end result will be division in the home.

sermons.title: How Satan Destroys a Church - Part 7 (WHO'S THE KING OF THE JUNGLE?)
sermons.description: If Satan can draw us to fight with his ways we'll lose the battle.  David fought Goliath with the weapons that God gave him, not with Saul's armor.  Satan will seek to draw us away from loving and obeying God, from prayer, and from our position of faith.  To do so will result in failure.  But we must stand strong in the Lord and believe Christ for the victory.

sermons.title: How to Make a Good Wife Better
sermons.description: Tom shares 8 responsibilities a husband has towards his wife from the Bible, using examples from his 22 years of married life to illustrate the principles.  There are many practical points, such as showing kindness, pleasing her, and expressing God's unconditional, unselfish and unending love.

sermons.title: Jesus Christ Himself
sermons.description: DELIVERED ON LORD'S-DAY MORNING, DECEMBER 9TH, 1877, BY C. H. SPURGEON, AT THE METROPOLITAN TABERNACLE, NEWINGTON. “Jesus Christ himself.”-Ephesians 2:20. “Jesus Christ himself” is to occupy all our thoughts this morning. What an ocean opens up before me! Here is sea-room for the largest barque! In which direction shall I turn your thoughts? I am embarrassed with riches. I know not where to begin: and when I once begin where shall I end? Assuredly we need not go abroad for joys this morning, for we have a feast at home. The words are few, but the meaning vast- “Jesus Christ himself.” Beloved, the religion of our Lord Jesus Christ contains in it nothing so wonderful as himself. It is a mass of marvels, but he is THE miracle of it; the wonder of wonders is “The Wonderful” himself. If proof be asked of the truth which he proclaimed, we point men to Jesus Christ himself. His character is unique. We defy unbelievers to imagine another like him. He is God and yet man, and we challenge them to compose a narrative in which the two apparently incongruous characters shall be so harmoniously blended, - in which the human and divine shall he so marvelously apparent, without the one overshadowing the other. They question the authenticity of the four Gospels; will they try and write a fifth? Will they even attempt to add a few incidents to the life which shall be worthy of the sacred biography, and congruous with those facts which are already described?

sermons.title: K-476 The Powers of the Air (1 of 2)
sermons.description: Speaking from Ephesians chapter 3, Art gives an understanding of the Church’s role toward the unseen world of the principalities and powers. An early expression of this theme given in 1986.

sermons.title: K-477 The Powers of the Air (2 of 2)
sermons.description: Speaking from Ephesians chapter 3, Art gives an understanding of the Church’s role toward the unseen world of the principalities and powers. An early expression of this theme given in 1986.

sermons.title: Loved with Everlasting Love - Part 1
sermons.description: God, the Father, reveals His eternal purpose to provide all that the believer needs to become all that God intended.

sermons.title: Loved with Everlasting Love - Part 2
sermons.description: God, the Father, reveals His eternal purpose to provide all that the believer needs to become all that God intended.

sermons.title: Loved with Everlasting Love - Part 3
sermons.description: God, the Father, reveals His eternal purpose to provide all that the believer needs to become all that God intended.

sermons.title: Loved with Everlasting Love - Part 4
sermons.description: God, the Father, reveals His eternal purpose to provide all that the believer needs to become all that God intended.

sermons.title: Loved with Everlasting Love - Part 5
sermons.description: God, the Father, reveals His eternal purpose to provide all that the believer needs to become all that God intended.

sermons.title: Man as You Are
sermons.description: Where many Christians are utterly content to only embrace the forgiveness of God, there remains a severe ignorance of God’s full intent through the power of Christ.  Before one becomes a partaker of the divine nature, Major Thomas expounds what man in fact is.  We discover he is a living soul wrapped in flesh, needing the Spirit of God to breathe life into his Spirit.  Once the man is forgiven his goal must become, through grace, to allow and yield the Spirit’s infiltration into jis soul and flesh that he may become an instrument of righteousness.

sermons.title: Meet Your Psychiatrist: He Helps You Make Decisions
Meet Your Psychiatrist: He Makes the Future Bright
New Life Baptist Church - Part 7
sermons.description: In this message, Paul deeply explores marriage and how God intends it as yet another method in conforming us to the image of His Son. He brings a freshness to this subject and the controversial debates that whirl around some Scriptures. A must for everyone who is married or anyone who has an inclination down that path.

sermons.title: On Being Filled with The Spirit
Our Motto
sermons.description: If we are enabled to adopt this motto it will, influence our work itself; and secondly elevate our spirit concerning that work. Should the Lord really be the all in all of our lives, it is after all only what he has a right to expect, and what we are under a thousand obligations to give to him.

sermons.title: Plan of Salvation - Election and Predestination (Eph. 1:3-14)
Prayer And Revival - Part 1
sermons.description: Pastor McLeod shares many passages of scripture and examples from his own experience of revival and some from the experience of others, emphasizing the importance of prayer, especially in the preparation of the work of God in the midst of His people. After a summary of testimonials that led up to the revival in Saskatoon, Bill touches upon several vital aspects that prayer has in effecting revival, which he defines as "Christians coming up to a New Testament level."  "Prayer," he says, "is the first thing and only thing."

sermons.title: Prayer Life of Paul for the Saints
sermons.description: Paul's unceasing prayer life for the saints demonstrated that he understood the worth and value of a human soul to God.  Smithers shows that prayerlessness bars access to people's hearts to further them in the Christian faith.  Do you pray for people?

sermons.title: Preparing to Stand In the Coming Storm
sermons.description: June 14, 2009 - There is a longing in the heart of God to give His church the resources that we need to be the people He has called us to be. The Bible says to keep asking and we will receive. But what are we asking for? This message makes an appeal to us to put away childish prayers that are self-focused and begin to ask for the power and provision we need to minister to fallen humanity. Ask God for a heart for this world and an awareness of how much He loves people. Those who are looking away from self and are given for the work of God will be given supernatural strength in the coming storm!

sermons.title: Purity of Speech As Believers in Christ
sermons.description: In this message, Pastor Cymbala teaches about how important words are. Words can benefit and encourage those that listen. He shares how many christians grieve the Holy Spirit continually through the day with their speech. For believers we should not have unwholesome speech, anger, slander, wrath or critical talk. God can purify our hearts and tongues so that they are pleasing in His sight.

sermons.title: Redemption, Forgiveness, and the Riches of His Grace
sermons.description: This message was preached on March 14, 2010 at All Saints Church in Logan, Utah. Part of a series on Ephesians entitled Grace in the Heavenlies, this message explores the glory of the grace of God in the redemption we have through the blood of Jesus Christ. Christianity does not end with forgiveness, it begins with it, and God is forming a people for Himself who have known His forgiveness and therefore know Him as He really is: the God of unsearchable grace. "...That we should be to the praise of his glory, who first trusted in Christ." (Ephesians 1:12)

sermons.title: Responsibility
sermons.description: Drawing both from scripture and his own experience as a Christian father, Paul Washer plainly expounds the responsibilities of fathers to their own sons and daughters. Building on the foundational principle of Godly character and example, he gives practical explanations of what it means to not provoke to anger; to instruct and train; to discipline and encourage; and to recognise a child’s God-given abilities. Fathers must invest in their children, he exhorts;  “Don’t give them things, give them you”. (49 minutes)

sermons.title: Return To Christ - The Need To Return
sermons.description: Stephen talks about the the Lord continually calling His people to return to Him throughout scripture. We can have one of two reactions when the Lord calls us to return. Wherein shall we return, Repent in dust and ashes.

sermons.title: Salvation by Faith (reading)
sermons.description: We often speak of salvation by faith, but what does that really mean? In this convicting sermon on Ephesians 2:8, Mr. Wesley brings new light to a familiar topic.

sermons.title: Satan and Endtimes
sermons.description: In a departure from his usual hortatory preaching, Ravenhill-as-diabologist leads us through a biblical survey of the nature, power and final overthrow of Lucifer.

sermons.title: Spirit Filled Family
sermons.description: Is your home a little foretaste of heaven on earth?  That's what the Holy Spirit has come to do--to bring the atmosphere of heaven!  Have you ever considered that a Spirit-filled husband and a Spirit-filled wife is unique to New Testament times and what that means?  Are you seeking practical help from God's Word to mold and shape your family to be pleasing to your beloved Savior Jesus Christ?  Zac Poonen shares a wealth of practical insight on family life, such as submission, honor, hypocritical motives, tests for tension, and many more!  (85 min.)

sermons.title: Spiritual Warfare Series - Fighting Together
sermons.description: There is power when Christians come together to pray, fight and intercede. When someone is struggling and can't pray for themselves, don't criticize, but cover them in prayer.

sermons.title: Steps In The Path To Being Filled With The Holy Spirit
That He Might Fill All Things - Part 2
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 08/01/1962.

sermons.title: That He Might Fill All Things - Part 3
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 08/01/1962.

sermons.title: That He Might Fill All Things - Part 4
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 08/01/1962.

sermons.title: The Beauty and Power of Unity
The Best Gift
sermons.description: What's the best gift you could ever give a loved one? God has the best gift for all of us. Let's trust the Lord and receive His blessing.

sermons.title: The Blessing of Obedience
sermons.description: We all have some area that we struggle with, but there is a blessing to obeying Jesus. Ephesians 1:17; James 1:22-25; Psalm 119:145-146

sermons.title: The Book of Ephesians
sermons.description: The Ephesian letter is one of Paul’s four "Imprisonment Letters" - Philippians, Colossians, and Philemon being the others. Although addressed to the church in Ephesus, this letter is generally believed to have been a circular discussing the believers’ exalted position through Christ, the Church as the body of Christ, her relationship to God, and practical implications of the Gospel.

sermons.title: The Churches Of Revelation
sermons.description: In this sombre prophetic message we look at the departing of many from the heart of Christ.Jesus warned the Ephesians that if they did not repent He would remove the candlestick from the midst.Alas today there are assemblies that resemble the tin man from the movie the wizard of Oz.They function,move,skip and dance along a golden road and yet they have no heart.The glory of God has departed and they have been found naked and  at home in their nakedness.It is my prayer that many would hear this message and encourage others to listen as i truly believe it to be applicable to this hour.

sermons.title: The Conflict of Two Wisdoms - Part 1
sermons.description: There are only two essential mind-sets or value systems in the world God's and that displayed by the powers of the air. This demonic realm has controverted the wisdom of God and made mankind to believe that their wisdom is where true reality is.

sermons.title: The Cost of the Resurrection Life
sermons.description: April 8, 2007 - The Christian life is a supernatural life. We are changed and transformed into a brand new person. When Jesus rose from the dead His resurrection life became available to all who would want it. If we are going to be blessed of God there is a journey involved. This journey will lead us to a place called Bethel where we are separated for the purposes of God. We will also be led to Jericho where we learn to trust God to break down every stronghold the the enemy has erected. As we walk with the Lord being one at heart with Him, He will anoint us and give us power to bring life into barren places.

sermons.title: The Cross and the New Covenant!
sermons.description: The Law was to bring us to the cross by showing us our own inability to make it or ever be good enough. The cross liberates us, the blood cleanses us from sin, and frees us from the law. The liberty of the New Covenant is freedom from sin, and bondage of striving in our flesh to be holy. Jesus refers to children in Matt 18, and warns against offending new Christians. We must allow the Holy Spirit to teach them, as we love them and pray for them. This is one of the best messages I've heard on the new covenant and the righteousness of Christ imputed to believers.

sermons.title: The Cup and the Fire - Part 4
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 10/01/1956.

sermons.title: The Divine Purpose and Principles of the Christian Life
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 01/01/1955.

sermons.title: The First Commandment With A Promise
The Four R's Of The Gospel: Redemption
The Gifts of the Spirit
sermons.description: We see how all have at least one gift of the Spirit, how there are many different gifts, but all are from the same Spirit. We see how the gifts cannot be used properly but in accordance with scripture, and how that they will be used for the edification of believers and cannot profit selfish gain. Pastor Fitch talks mostly about the most contentious gift that of Tongues. We also see how no one person has all the gifts of the Spirit but we are supposed to have all the fruits of the Spirit.

sermons.title: The Glory Of God - Part 3
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 06/01/1966. The glory of God is expressed in the trinity. God the Father is the source of glory. The Father takes personal responsibility for His children to bring them unto glory. Jesus Christ is the Lord of glory. He is the One that is in control to bring forth the glory of God. Jesus Christ is faithful to bring forth all of our adverse circumstances to work for His glory. The Holy Spirit is the Spirit of glory. The Spirit of glory can take hold of the things that would be to our own undoing and turn them for the glory of God.

sermons.title: The Hiding Place
sermons.description: How great, how wide, how deep is the love God has for us. His own son was sent as an offering to die for our sins. He loves you more than you can ever know. Run to God today where there is safety.

sermons.title: The Holocaust and Christian Conscience
sermons.description: Why does God allow the Holocaust and all human suffering to take place? This is the ultimate question. The necessary truth of God’s judgment and an inescapable requirement of true repentance for true faith unto salvation, are at the heart of the answer. This message relates the Holocaust to the historical rejection of God. A vital and challenging message for the Jewish people and the Church given at the national Charismatic Conference at Kansas City in 1977 as a historic event!

sermons.title: The Holy Spirit Gives Power
sermons.description: Billy Graham gives an opening statement at the Lausanne congress 1974 asking for prayer and introduces Corrie Ten Boom in the meeting. Corrie speaks on the need of the Holy Spirit Power in the Christian life. She speaks on how we can have God's boundless resources when we obey the happy commandment to be filled with the Spirit. The Spirit of God gives us the power to be witnesses for the great commission.

sermons.title: The Horizon of Divine Purpose - Part 1
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 08/01/1961.

sermons.title: The Horizon of Divine Purpose - Part 6
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 08/01/1961.

sermons.title: The Last Man Standing
sermons.description: May 15,2005 - Jesus knows our heart and He sees the secret inward desire and longing for Him – He sets before us an open door that no man can shut. This door is Jesus Himself and all His resources and sustenance is our in abundance. Jesus will write His name upon all who seek Him with all their heart and there will be a visible evidence of stability.

sermons.title: The Missing Presence of Christ
sermons.description: Rolfe Barnard shares from a deep prophetic burden of the lack of the true conception of what Church is. He also laments the lacking presence of Christ in the midst of assemblies in America. Truly there is a deep need for revival in our day.

sermons.title: The Missing Presence of Christ by Rolfe Barnard
sermons.description: Rolfe Barnard shares from a deep prophetic burden of the lack of the true conception of what Church is. He also laments the lacking presence of Christ in the midst of assemblies in America. Truly there is a deep need for revival in our day.

sermons.title: The Mysteries of the Faith
sermons.description: A brief examination of some of the mysteries of the faith (from the book of Ephesians), so long lost to the church, but now in the process of being restored by God.

sermons.title: The New Creation - Part 2
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 11/01/1955.

sermons.title: The Occult
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod covers the subject of the occult showing what things are hidden and beyond the bounds of normal human knowledge. Such occult is demonic and opposed to the counsel and spirit of God. We are to have no fellowship with the hidden things of darkness but rather reprove and uncover these things.

sermons.title: The Occult by Bill Mcleod
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod covers the subject of the occult showing what things are hidden and beyond the bounds of normal human knowledge. Such occult is demonic and opposed to the counsel and spirit of God. We are to have no fellowship with the hidden things of darkness but rather reprove and uncover these things.

sermons.title: The Revival Hymn
sermons.description: This is a very powerful audio message that will stir your spirit for revival! Clips of following speakers included in this message: Ian Paisley, Leonard Ravenhill, Paris Reidhead, Duncan Campbell, A.W. Tozer, T. Austin Sparks. This is probably one of the most potent and powerful audio recordings on this entire site. You will be changed as you listen to this compilation.

sermons.title: The Singular Origin of a Christian Man
sermons.description: “I would dwell upon man as God's workmanship in a still higher sense than by his first making. Created anew “unto good works, which God hath before prepared that we should walk in them.”

sermons.title: The Spirit Filled Life
sermons.description: 'The question is not,' Oswald J. Smith contends, 'Do I have the Holy Spirit?' but, 'Am I filled with the Holy Spirit?'  Smith shows how this commandment to be filled with the Spirit is essential to have power over sin and power for service.  HOW may I be filled?  Five conditions are laid out to consider: confession, renunciation, surrender, obedience and faith.  Mr. Smith closes with his own personal testimony of how God broke him in ministry and humbled him sorely so that he could be used in the power of the Spirit and not in the energy of the flesh.

sermons.title: The Spirit Filled Life by Oswald J. Smith
sermons.description: 'The question is not,' Oswald J. Smith contends, 'Do I have the Holy Spirit?' but, 'Am I filled with the Holy Spirit?' Smith shows how this commandment to be filled with the Spirit is essential to have power over sin and power for service. HOW may I be filled? Five conditions are laid out to consider: confession, renunciation, surrender, obedience and faith. Mr. Smith closes with his own personal testimony of how God broke him in ministry and humbled him sorely so that he could be used in the power of the Spirit and not in the energy of the flesh.

sermons.title: The Way To Spiritual Ascendancy 1
sermons.description: One who is living the "ascended life" is one who sees earthly things from a heavenly view, sees Christ's throne reigning over all, and is for the most part freed from self cares and self interests.  Brother Dana shares the pitfalls of religion and "soulish ascendancy" that take a believer away from Jesus Christ.  (These messages were delivered at Harvey Cedars Conference in October, 2002)

sermons.title: The Way To Spiritual Ascendancy 2
sermons.description: "Until the throne room is central to church life," Dana warns, "we're not gathering under an open heaven."  If we are going to represent the Lord Jesus Christ, we will encounter all kinds of opposition--counterfeit ministry, demonic opposition, interference in the prayer meetings, and so on.  To counteract the principalities and powers, we must know what it means to be filled with the Spirit.

sermons.title: The Whole Armour of God - Part 1
The Whole Armour of God - Part 2
The Whole Armour of God - Part 4
The conflict of Two Wisdoms - Part 2
sermons.description: There are only two essential mind-sets or value systems in the world¾God's and that displayed by the powers of the air. This demonic realm has controverted the wisdom of God and made mankind to believe that their wisdom is where true reality is.

sermons.title: Understanding Marriage - Reasons for a Wife's Submission
Understanding Marriage - Spiritual Preparation for Marriage
Understanding Spiritual Authority (Part 2): The Purpose and the Limits of Authority
sermons.description: November 2, 2005 - This is a teaching about righteous and unrighteous authority and the principals of action we must follow to deal with the situation. Humility and a non argumentative attitude is much needed in these particular situations.

sermons.title: VICTORIOUS LIFE
sermons.description: God’s power is stronger than all the energy in our universe - and greater than all our bondages, sins and problems. But how can we experience this in our life? The answer is in this meditation!

sermons.title: WITH ALL OUR HEART
sermons.description: God loves today.  We can only share His power and life when we also share His love.  This love He has revealed to us through the sacrifice of His Son and this love He gives to us that we might fulfill the true purpose of our life.  This meditation calls us to return to Him the love He so longs to receive from us.

sermons.title: WITH ALL OUR HEART!
sermons.description: God lives and works today! And He loves today. We can only share His power and life when we also share His love. This love He has revealed to us through the sacrifice of His Son and this love He gives to us that we might fulfill the true purpose of our life. Today's meditation, WITH ALL OUR HEART by Basilea Schlink, calls us to return to Him the love He so longs to receive from us.

sermons.title: What is Apostolic?
sermons.description: Another superb expression of a limitless theme in which Art seeks to identify some of the key aspects of this most holy word.

sermons.title: Widows and Slaves Indeed
sermons.description: Art addresses the little understood subject of what constitutes a true widow and the place of slavery in Paul's time, as applicable now as it was then. There is an understanding beyond what our natural eye sees, and it is into this realm that God wants to draw us the genius of what is apostolic.

sermons.title: YOU WILL NEVER BE ASHAMED
sermons.description: God is the same yesterday, today, and forever. That means we can count on Him. He will always fulfill His promises and He will never let His children down! But how can we become His children? The answer is in this meditation!

sermons.title: You Can Fulfill God's Perfect Plan
sermons.description: Sacrifice and Sovereignty is the balance of Chrstian Life. Painful self-denial and submitting our wills to God ensure we have walked in the perfect will of God. Amongst all the problems and doubts we can trust a loving Heavenly Father that He is desiring and leads us into His perfect will for our life's. Into a life full of good works that glorifies the death of Christ for our sins giving us eternal life.

sermons.title: You Can Fulfill God's Perfect Plan by Zac Poonen
sermons.description: Sacrifice and Sovereignty is the balance of Chrstian Life. Painful self-denial and submitting our wills to God ensure we have walked in the perfect will of God. Amongst all the problems and doubts we can trust a loving Heavenly Father that He is desiring and leads us into His perfect will for our life's. Into a life full of good works that glorifies the death of Christ for our sins giving us eternal life.

sermons.title: Your Full Potential in Christ
sermons.description: Paris Reidhead looks at Ephesians for a manual to reach our full potential in Jesus Christ. We were not saved just to make it to heaven but to have  great maturity and fruitfulness in this life for the glory of Jesus Christ. He has everything that we need for everything that He has planned for us in the purpose of the Lord.
